TopicTitle: KSP crashes on return to the Space Centre.

Articles.Content:
So this seeme to be a fairly common problem, i get it every single time i play, and its a bit tedious. there are lots of requests for help and very few constructive answers, for my part i have had the same issues now since 1.1 and cant figure out what is causing the crashes, i know some of the mods are out of date, but at some point or another they where up to date so could someone please tell me whats actually wrong here, or how to interpret the crash file?



KSP: 1,3 64bit on Windows 10

Problem: return or recovery crashes the game to desktop after a few returns, usually 4 

Mods installed:

Reproduction steps:

go from the space centre to a spacecraft, dosent matter how you do it, after a few returns to the space centre the game will crash

 

KSP_x64.exe caused an Access Violation (0xc0000005)
  in module KSP_x64.exe at 0033:14944a83.

Error occurred at 2017-07-15_210428.
C:\Users\Johny\Desktop\Kerbal Space Program\KSP_x64.exe, run by Johny.
40% memory in use.
32721 MB physical memory [19327 MB free].
37585 MB paging file [23225 MB free].
134217728 MB user address space [134207832 MB free].
Read from location ffffffff caused an access violation.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/891fkk6jn2epnon/error.log?dl=0
https://www.dropbox.com/s/8e87aq82nbqz2o3/crash.dmp?dl=0

 

Edited July 15, 2017 by Space Kadet

I can tell you right now, that you are running at least one mod which is not updated.

It also appears that you may have two copies of the Mark IV Spaceplane mod installed (both of which are marked as for 1.2.2 only)

You have something which is spamming your log with Dynamic Battery Storage messages

You have something which is spamming your log with Dynamic Battery Storage messages

 

Ill try pulling them out and seeing whats up, i know their out of date but they seem to work fine, and i was getting the same crashes in 1.2.2 when they where at the correct version....

@Nertea that dbs error might help you in bug checking, i doubt thats causing my crashes because its only been on a week

@linuxgurugamer thanks for the help! Ill see what i find.
You have so many mods, would be best to remove 1/2 of them, see if it happens, if it does, then you can repeat, if it doesn't then swap the ones which you removed with the ones there and try again.
Ive tried that a few times and have never solved it, thats why i was wondering if someone could see exactly what is wrong from the log. However today is all about trying to fix this!

So no luck so far with pulling mods, however im sure although this is caused by a mod, its a game issue, because jumping between craft has no problem only returning to the space centre. that and its a bug thats been present since 1.1 at least
so ive taken out all the older mods, and now im just getting hard crashes to the desktop with no error logs

https://www.dropbox.com/s/zu0fv6n78th5nvx/output_log.txt?dl=0

heres the main ksp log file from this recent CTD

1 hour ago, Space Kadet said:

so ive taken out all the older mods, and now im just getting hard crashes to the desktop with no error logs

So now take out all mods, then add them back in, a few at a time

4 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

So now take out all mods, then add them back in, a few at a time

i wish i could but testing stability takes about 40 minutes to get a crash including the loading screens, then adding and repeating. your talking about 9 or 10 days worth of testing for my modlist, and thats alot of time i was hoping using the log files someone could help me read them and tell me what im looking for because i got these types of crashes in previous versions where iw as using almost no similar mods, i was more mks based. 

theres alot of errors in the main logfile, and the crash dump seems to suggest theres a memory allocation error

the reason im trying to avoid mod deletion at the moment is im trying to get my next video out on my persistant save, so that causes even more issues finding parts and re organising save files.
Wish I could help more, but based on what you say, seems like some sort of memory issue.  As you say, lots of errors in the logs, which makes it hard to identify a single culprit.

I have a loose suspicion its something to do with one of the community backbones, like @RoverDude's crp, or  @allista's utils because ive had them the longest while almose all the other mods have changed at some point. I just cant figure iut what im looking at in the logs. 

It has to be a weird conflict too because its common enough to see other people have had the problem, but not enough that anyone has an answer....

i shall keep looking and posting logs every time it crashes, but at the monent i make a point of only playing one launch at a time because of rebooting after a crash.

Thanks @linuxgurugamer for your help!
